snippet: Jens Kotainy, a grandmaster from Germany, was thought to be using his cellphone to access a chess computer program at the Sparkassen Chess Meeting in Dortmund, Germany.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column; German grandmaster Jens Kotainy is disqualified at the Sparkassen Chess Meeting in Dortmund, Germany, after officials questioned how he was using his cellphone; tournament officials suspect he was accessing a chess computer program.
lead_paragraph: Jens Kotainy, a grandmaster from Germany, was thought to be using his cellphone to access a chess computer program at the Sparkassen Chess Meeting in Dortmund, Germany.

headline.print_headline: A Master Is Disqualified Over Suspicions of Cheating
headline.main: A Master Is Disqualified Over Suspicions of Cheating
